intro: Cacalia aplinii, commonly known as the New Zealand bellflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are blue to violet in color, with a distinctive bell-shaped appearance, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Cacalia aplinii is often found in open habitats and is adapted to the temperate climate of New Zealand.
